poem:
**Giselle's Echo**

In the whisper of her steps,  
fragile grace breathes—  
a village heart pauses,  
echoed in soft orchestral sighs.  
Youthful strength hides  
behind a veil of silken tulle,  
as stage boards tenderly  
capture her faded pulse  
in eternal pirouettes—  
we swoon,  
caught in her delicate fall.  
Even Giselle's shadow dances on.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "‘We fell in love with the ballet and with her’: why 184-year-old Giselle keeps us swooning ‘I thought I looked too healthy to play her,” says Miyako Yoshida of her debut in Giselle, back in the 90s, when she was a vibrant, strong young dancer asked to play the part of the sweet village girl with a weak heart. “But from the first time I came on stage, I could just live her,” she says;". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
news: ‘We fell in love with the ballet and with her’: why 184-year-old Giselle keeps us swooning ‘I thought I looked too healthy to play her,” says Miyako Yoshida of her debut in Giselle, back in the 90s, when she was a vibrant, strong young dancer asked to play the part of the sweet village girl with a weak heart. “But from the first time I came on stage, I could just live her,” she says;
